thread.title: Huddersfield Town 0-0 Manchester City: Pep Guardiola's men held in FA Cup stalemate - 5 Things We Learned
thread.title_full: Huddersfield Town 0-0 Manchester City: Pep Guardiola's men held in FA Cup stalemate - 5 Things We Learned

author: Jim Daly
title: Huddersfield Town 0-0 Manchester City: Pep Guardiola's men held in FA Cup stalemate - 5 Things We Learned
text:
Jack Payne of Huddersfield Town shoots (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester City were held to a goalless draw at Huddersfield in the FA Cup fifth round. 
Pep Guardiola's side couldn't find a way through David Wagner's hard-working Championship side and will go through it all again in a replay. 
On a day where non-league Lincoln shocked Burnley, City avoided an upset but will have been aiming for a win and a place in the quarter-final. 
But what did we learn from the John Smith's Stadium? Here are five things... View gallery Kompany's injury woes continue 
Vincent Kompany had been expected to return from injury against Huddersfield but instead missed out... due to another injury . 
But Kompany did not train on Friday after picking up a fresh injury and will miss City's trip to the John Smith's Stadium. 
Kompany has made one appearance in 2017, playing the full 90 minutes in City's 3-0 FA Cup win at Crystal Palace three weeks ago. 
Guardiola and his medical team have used Kompany sparingly as the 30-year-old makes his way back from the latest setback of an injury-ravaged period 
The latest set-back is not thought to be major but will be a blow to the City captain as he tries to return from yet another injury. A familiar sight for Man City fans (Photo: Reuters) Guardiola takes the FA Cup seriously 
With the Premier League title all but gone the FA Cup is the next best chance for Pep Guardiola to win a trophy in his debut season in England. 
And the City manager proved that by fielding a strong team in a competition where plenty of Premier League sides have put out weakened sides. 
The likes of Sergio Aguero, Nolito, Fernando and Fernandinho all featured at the John Smith's Stadium but still found it hard work against the Championship side. 
Reinforcements in Kevin de Bruyne and Leroy Sane were chucked on in the second half to try and win it but couldn't find a breakthrough. City's Fernandinho in action with Huddersfield Town's Dean Whitehead (Photo: REUTERS) Delph was lucky to stay on 
Fabian Delph was lucky not to be sent off for a dangerous challenge on Colin Quaner which would easily have been a red card. 
Instead the City man wasn't even booked for a tackle that saw him end up horizontal with his studs on Quaner's thighs after winning the ball and following through onto his opponent. 
Delph was lucky to avoid any punishment in all honesty. Delph was lucky not to be sent off (Photo: Gareth Copley) Aguero didn't take his chance to impress Pep 
Sergio Aguero has found his previously guaranteed starting place for Man City under threat from Gabriel Jesus of late. 
There are rumours the Argentina star will be leaving the Etihad at the end of the season with Chelsea and Real Madrid linked. 
Jesus has picked up a serious injury meaning Aguero will probably get back into the team but he offered little suggestion at Huddersfield to prove he deserves that. And it was the sort of performance that only fuels fires of a departure in the summer. Sergio Aguero had a game to forget (Photo: Getty) Guardiola continues to struggle 
It just going Pep Guardiola's way since arriving in England. 
The Premier League has been unforgiving and now even the FA Cup isn't going his way. 
Hudderfield made it hard for City but in truth the Citizens were disappointing on the day. 
A replay beckons as Guardiola's struggles since arriving from Germany continue. Guardiola's frustrations in England continue (Photo: AFP) poll loading Will Sergio Aguero leave Manchester City this summer? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
